group.speak: Sunlight filters down through the canopy. There is a young girl in the center of the clearing. The turns an object in her hands, and light dances off of both it and her face.
Do ya see this mister? It's so pretty and reflective. Why, I'd bet it's the shiniest shiny that ever did shine.
Do ya see this ma'am? It's so pretty and reflective. Why, I'd bet it's the shiniest shiny that ever did shine.
The girl shows you a piece of Aluminum Foil.
The girl shows you a fishing lure.
The girl shows you a fishing lure. In response, you show her the piece of Aluminum Foil. She drops the fishing lure.
Wow. That's even shinier! Can I have it? Pwease?
You give her the aluminum foil. You then go to pick up the fishing lure.
Oh, yeah. I have this shiny now so I don't need that one. Go ahead.
It is rather relaxing here. You lie down.
You begin to contemplate the universe and its infinite mysteries.
You haven't been here that long, but you still think the Sun should have noticably moved in the time you've been here.
In fact, you've never looked at whether you produce a shadow. It would probably be jaring if you didn't, and even the most primitive 3D games draw shadows.
You actually look, and realize you're not producing a shadow.
In fact, you're not actually looking at where your shadow should be. You're looking at a console terminal that is telling you that you're looking at your shadow.

You check really carefully at the previous string of characters in hopes of finding an incorrect usage of "you're" or "your" so that you may yell at whoever wrote it about correct "your/you're" usage.
"String". That word sounded important. Or looked important. Whichever. You grab a few characters off the console terminal just in case.
One of the girl's shouts brings you out of your contemplative daze.
